data.title: A guide to Dolly Parton's properties in Pigeon Forge, Gatlinburg and beyond
data.meta_description: We all know Dolly Parton is savvy business woman, but just how many entertainment properties does she own? Here's a list.
data.text:
We all know Dolly Parton is a savvy business woman.

She's made her mark on the music, film and television industries, written books and created her Imagination Library program, which gives free books to children.

DOLLY PARTON: What Dolly Parton has cooking for rest of 2018, 2019

Parton's influence also stretches to her family destinations in East Tennessee and beyond, but just how many entertainment properties does she own? Here's a list with basic info, prices and other details.

1. Dollywood theme park

Perhaps the most well-known of Parton's properties, the Dollywood theme park boasts thrill rides, shows, shops, children's activities, food, festivals and other attractions.

DOLLYWOOD JOBS: How you can snag a job at the park

Parton jointly owns Dollywood, Dollywood's Splash Country, Dollywood's DreamMore Resort and Dollywood's Smoky Mountain Cabins with Herschend Family Entertainment.

Dollywood employees refer to her as their "Dreamer in Chief" because she offers insight when they made changes or additions to the park.

The park's most recent addition is still coming together. Dollywood will open its new $37 million expansion, Wildwood Grove, in May, and it will feature a themed land with 11 attractions.

Dollywood, at 2700 Dollywood Parks Blvd. in Pigeon Forge, will open for its 2019 season on March 16. The park has ticket and season pass options.

One-day tickets to the theme park range from $56.95 to $69.95. The park also has two-day and three-day ticket options.

Season passes include unlimited visits to Dollywood during its 2019 season and other perks. They range from $119-$194 with child and senior discount pricing available.

2. Dollywood's Splash Country

Not far from the theme park sits Dollywood's Splash Country, a water park with multiple attractions.

Splash Country offers water slides, play areas, pools, a low-speed float experience, food vendors, shops and canopy rentals.

SPLASH COUNTRY: Water slide at Dollywood's Splash Country gives super-soaked thrills

You can get to Splash Country through the Dollywood entrance. The water park is set to open for its 2019 season on May 18.

One-day tickets for Splash Country range from $44.95-$49.95. The water park has two-and three-day ticket options as well as season passes. Splash Country season passes range from $89-$174.

3. Dollywood's DreamMore Resort and Spa

Dollywood's DreamMore Resort and Spa, 2525 DreamMore Way, Pigeon Forge, is a short drive from the theme park and Splash Country.

The 300-room resort has eight types of rooms with varying layouts along with a Parton penthouse suite with details and decor inspired by her.

DREAMMORE RESORT: What it's like to stay at Dollywood's DreamMore Resort

Amenities include multiple restaurants, a spa, an outdoor pool with waterfalls, a game room, nightly storytime for kids, a fitness room, free trolley rides to the theme park and Splash Country, live music and more.

DreamMore's spa services and restaurant, Song & Hearth, are also available to people not staying at the resort.

For rates and availability at DreamMore, visit www.dollywood.com/Resort or call 1-800-365-5996.

4. Dollywood's Smoky Mountain Cabins

Dollywood's Smoky Mountain Cabins offer rentals in Pigeon Forge and Gatlinburg.

The cabins can accommodate up to 30 guests. Amenities include Smoky Mountain views, hot tubs, fireplaces, kitchens, pools, grills, home theater rooms, a children's playground and more.

For more information or to book a cabin, call 866-857-2123 or visit www.dollywood.com/Cabins.

5. Dolly Parton's Stampede

In addition to theme parks, Parton also has a presence in the dinner show industry.

She jointly owns Dolly Parton's Stampede and Pirates Voyage dinner shows with World Choice Investments.

Her Stampede dinner show has locations in Pigeon Forge and Branson, Missouri.

The dinner show features 32 horses and trick riding, music written by Parton, special effects, comedy and fireworks. It also includes a four-course meal with gluten-free and vegetarian options.

Tickets range from $49.99-$56.99 for adults and $29.99 for kids ages 3-11.

For more information and tickets, visit dpstampede.com or call 865-453-4400 for the Pigeon Forge location and 417-336-3000 for the Branson location.

6. Pirates Voyage Dinner & Show

Parton's Pirates Voyage Dinner & Show has one location in Myrtle Beach, South Carolina, and another one will open in Pigeon Forge in the spring.

The show features swashbuckling pirates, acrobatics, live animals, mermaids, music from Parton and Mark Brymer, and a four-course meal.

PIRATES VOYAGE: Dolly Parton to open Pigeon Forge Pirates Voyage dinner attraction in 2019

Ticket prices start at $49.99 for adults and $29.99 for children at the Myrtle Beach location. Prices will be determined at a later date for the Pigeon Forge location.

For more information, visit piratesvoyage.com or call 843-497-9700 for the Myrtle Beach location.

7. Smoky Mountain Opry

Parton and World Choice Investments acquired four longtime Pigeon Forge properties earlier this year, including Smoky Mountain Opry, the Hatfield & McCoy Dinner Feud, the Comedy Barn and Frizzle Chicken Farmhouse Café.

DOLLY PARTON: Dolly Parton's dinner show company buys Smoky Mountain Opry, Comedy Barn, Hatfield & McCoy

Smoky Mountain Opry, 2046 Parkway, features variety shows with music, dancing, singing, special effects and comedy. Its 2019 season will begin in March.

For more information, visit smokymtnopry.com or call 865-428-7469.

8. Hatfield & McCoy Dinner Feud

The Hatfield & McCoy Dinner Feud, 119 Music Road, presents a comedic take on the famous feud between the Hatfield and McCoy families in the 1800s.

The show includes singing, dancing, stunts, comedy and a Southern-style dinner with fried chicken, creamy soup, corn and other offerings.

Show times are 5 p.m. and 8 p.m. daily. Ticket prices are $56.99 for adults and $26.99 for kids ages 3-11.

For more information, visit hatfieldmccoydinnerfeud.com or call 865-908-7469.

9. Comedy Barn

The Comedy Barn, 2775 Parkway, features variety shows with live music, performers, magicians, jugglers, ventriloquists and comedians.

The shows take place nightly at 5 p.m. and 8:15 p.m. Tickets cost $34.99 for adults and $9.99 for kids ages 3-11.

For more information, visit www.comedybarn.com or call 865-428-5222.

10. Frizzle Chicken Farmhouse Café

The Frizzle Chicken Farmhouse Café, 2785 Parkway, sits next to the Comedy Barn.

The restaurant is open from 7:30 a.m. to 2 p.m. on Saturdays and Sundays, and singing chickens adorn its walls.

The menu includes breakfast and lunch staples including pancakes, biscuits, omelets and sandwiches.
